66 THE ODES OF HORACE.

Here, within the deep vale, thou shalt shun the red dog-star, An'd shalt sing us that tale on the lute-strings of TeOS, · How Penelope vied with the Sea's Crystal Circe, for one human heart3 ,

Safely here shalt thou quaff, under cool leafy shadows, Sober cups from the innocent vineyards of Lesbos 3 ’Tis not here that gay Semele’s son ἃ Shall with Mars his encounters confound 3

Dread not here lest pert Cyrus, suspecting thee vilely, Lay rash hands on that form not a match for rude anger, Rend the garland which clings to thy hair, Or the robe—which deserves no such wrong.

ἃ Bacchus.
